business.headline: House rent above Rs 50,000? Here's the TDS rule you need to knowFor tenants living in high-rent homes, the line between a routine payment and a tax lapse can be thinner than it seems, and ignoring it can invite penalties that quickly snowball.

HUL shares gain 2% today. Should you buy the FMCG stock?HUL share price: The stock has gained 3.67% in the last five trading sessions. However, when looking at a longer time frame, the stock is still down 7.97% over the past year.

Lost Rs 18 lakh in 6 months: Financial advisor's warning on online bettingWhat begins as casual fun can spiral into secrecy, debt, and broken trust. A financial advisor warns that, without strong regulation, betting apps are fast becoming one of India's biggest financial threats.

Tariffs on steel, auto unlikely in interim trade deal with US: Government sourcesWith the US to soon notify countries of higher tariffs by July 9, with new rates effective August 1, sectoral levies on steel, auto and aluminium are unlikely in the India-US interim trade deal, government sources said.
Sensex opens 100 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; HUL up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 65.28 points to 83,367.61, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 16.45 points to 25,444.55 as of 9:50 am.

Trump reveals tariff letter plan with a twist: Here's what's coming nextTrump also said that any country supporting what he called the 'Anti-American policies' of the BRICS group will face an additional 10% tariff.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty fall as Trump singals delay in tariffs?The Gift Nifty futures were trading at 25,512 as of 8:08 am., suggesting that the Nifty 50 may open around its previous close of 25,461. Sensex and Nifty declined by 0.7% each last week.

The stark irony of world's 4th largest economy with 81 crore free-mealersIndia's growing wealth gap often sparks despair, but the author, a retired ESIC Regional Director, argues the real solution lies in enforcing India's long-ignored labour laws.

Oxford India Forum 2025 celebrates India's rising influence, youthful ambitionThe Oxford India Forum 2025 brought together a dynamic mix of business leaders, policymakers, entrepreneurs, academics and students to reflect on India's evolving global role and the path forward.

The Great Indian Salary CrisisWhite-collar employees in India are caught in a salary spiral where costs keep climbing, pay moves slowly, and financial stability slips further away. On paper, the economy is booming, but the pay cheques of working middle-class Indians tell a very different story.
India proposes retaliatory duties at world trade body against US tariffs on autosIndia has proposed to impose an equivalent amount of duty collected from products originating in the United States.

Real Estate vs Mutual Funds: Where should you invest, explains stock market expertOwning a house was once every family's dream, but times have changed. With high prices and new ways to invest, is real estate still smart, or are mutual funds better? A stock market expert explains.

Ankur Mehra says creators must think like startups, not influencersAnkur Mehra, in his new book Pixels to Profits, urges creators to stop chasing follower counts and instead build sustainable, multi-platform businesses.

Success isn't about number of followers in creator economy: Ankur MehraIn a conversation with Business Today's Sakshi Batra, Ankur Mehra, author of Pixels to Profits, explains what it really takes to succeed in the creator economy, and why chasing viral fame or follower counts may be the wrong metric altogether.
Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%Sensex ends 192 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Infosys gains 1%

India tags it, West sells it. Can Prada's Kolhapuri row lead to real reform?The luxury brand's new "toe-ring sandal" has ignited not just cultural outrage but also legal action in India, with a Public Interest Litigation filed in the Bombay High Court.

Where are ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms? Why they're missing and what to doIt's ITR season but many taxpayers can't find the ITR-2 and ITR-3 forms on the Income Tax portal yet. If you have capital gains, foreign income or business income, this delay might worry you. The good news is there's an extended deadline this year. Here's why these forms are missing and what you should do next.

SBI credit card rules changing from July 15: Here's what cardholders must knowAt present, many cardholders pay only a small part of their bill to avoid late charges. But now, the way the minimum amount due (MAD) is calculated will change starting July 15, 2025.

One in 4 Indians still below minimum standard of living: World BankDespite a sharp drop in extreme poverty, about one in four Indians still falls below the level needed to meet essential needs and maintain a minimum standard of living.

Sebi bans Jane Street for stock market manipulation. Here's what went wrongUS Trading Firm Jane Street: Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) said the trades executed by the group were "prima facie fraudulent and manipulative" and violated the country's capital market regulations.

Want Rs 36 lakh in 5 years? Know who can avail this government schemeThis government scheme offers guaranteed returns, so you don't have to worry about market ups and downs. For the current quarter, the interest rate is fixed at 7.7% per year.

Why did Soham Parekh work multiple jobs? Indian techie shares his reasonsHe confirmed that he worked at several companies simultaneously and misrepresented his location and employment status in the process.

Gold gathering dust in locker? Financial advisor explains how to make it workA financial advisor has warned that family gold stored in lockers faces risk from rust, floods, and poor insurance. He explains how a scheme can offer safety and steady returns instead.

EPF, NPS can build Rs 12 crore retirement fund. Tax expert breaks it downFor salaried individuals earning up to Rs 14.65 lakh annually, Bangar believes this combination offers the best of both worlds: zero tax under the new regime and long-term wealth creation.
Sensex opens 82 points higher, Nifty below 25,500; Bajaj Finance up 2%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 46.97 points to 83,286.44, while the NSE Nifty50 added 14.45 points to 25,419.75 as of 9:22 am.

HCLTech joins hands with OpenAI to take AI to businessesThe collaboration aims to help global companies adopt AI at scale, combining HCLTech's industry experience with OpenAI's advanced AI models and tools.

Global trading firm Jane Street banned by Sebi from securities marketAccording to an order published on Sebi's website, the regulator has ordered the seizure of Rs 48.4 billion (approximately $570 million), which it claims is the total amount of illegal profit made by Jane Street.

DA hike July 2025: 4% increase likely for central government employeesDearness Allowance is revised twice a year, in January and July. It is based on the average of All India Consumer Price Index for Industrial Workers (AICPI-IW) data over the past 12 months.

Nvidia to become world's most valued company ever with $3.9 trillion market capNvidia is set to become the most valuable company ever, reaching a $3.92 trillion market cap amid soaring AI demand. Its dominance in AI chipmaking has fuelled rapid growth, outpacing rivals like Apple and Microsoft.

IndiGo appoints former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as non-executive directorIndiGo has appointed former NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant as a Non-Executive Director on its board, pending regulatory and shareholder approvals.

RBI bars foreclosure charges on floating rate loans to micro, small businessesAccording to the new rules, no prepayment charges will be allowed on floating rate loans to MSEs or to individuals borrowing for business purposes.

How poor is 'poor' in India?Millions of Indians have exited extreme poverty, yet many still live one crisis away from hunger, debt, or despair. In this deep dive, we examine why poverty is retreating in numbers, but not in reality.

Meesho files confidential papers for IPO to raise Rs 4,250 crore: ReportMeesho is a well-known player in India's booming e-commerce space, taking on giants like Amazon and Flipkart, with big global investors such as Prosus, Elevation Capital, WestBridge Capital, SoftBank, and Peak XV Partners backing it.
Sensex settles 170 points lower, Nifty below 25,500; Maruti down 1%The S&P BSE Sensex was down by 170.22 points to end at 83,239.47, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 48,10 points to close at 25,405.30.

Don't set and forget: Why your SIPs need regular check-upsWhile the idea of 'set it and forget it' may seem peaceful, doing so could lead to long-term underperformance, missed opportunities, or even a shortfall in your retirement goals.

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath cautions investors against risks in unlisted sharesNithin Kamath said that many people get carried away by the hype around buying shares of companies before they go public. But in reality, unlisted shares are risky and can leave investors stuck without a way to sell.

Has the oil market grown numb to conflict in the Middle East?Global oil demand growth in 2025 is on track to be just 870,000 barrels per day. This would make it the weakest year for oil demand since 2001, except during major economic disruptions like the 2008 financial crisis and the COVID-19 pandemic.

India's income inequality now worse than British era, says financial analystThe divide between India's rich and poor is bigger than ever, with almost half the people surviving on very little, while a privileged few hold most of the wealth, says Hardik Joshi, a financial analyst.

HDFC Bank CEO moves Supreme Court against Lilavati Hospital FIRThe clash between one of India's largest private banks and a big Mumbai hospital is linked to a financial transaction, but the exact details of the FIR or the amount involved were not shared in court.

Lost your ITR login? Here's how to file income tax using net bankingIf you can't remember your Income Tax portal password, you don't need to reset it straight away. Most major banks in India allow you to access the e-Filing portal through their net banking services. It's a safe and easy way to file your return on time.

entertainment.headline: Nobody wanted to launch Amitabh Bachchan's son: Abhishek on industry's rejectionAbhishek Bachchan reflected on his initial days in the industry and shared that he faced initial rejections due to his father's giant film legacy. He said directors were hesitant to launch him, fearing expectations.

Aamir Khan travels all the way to Hyderabad to name Vishnu-Jwala Gutta's daughterAamir Khan named the daughter of Vishnu Vishal and Jwala Gutta, Mira, in an emotional ceremony in Hyderabad. The couple shared photos from the event.

Rishab Shetty roars with rage in birthday poster of Kantara Chapter 1Actor Rishab Shetty's poster from his upcoming fantasy action-thriller 'Kantara: Chapter 1' was unveiled on his birthday. The film is scheduled to release on October 2, 2025.

Parag Tyagi dismisses rumours about dog Simba's health after Shefali Jariwala's deathActor Parag Tyagi addressed rumours about his dog Simba's health after his actor-wife Shefali Jariwala's death. He stated that his pet is doing well and 'performing rituals as a son' to Shefali.

Metro In Dino box office Day 3: Basu's film beats his Life in a Metro in 1st weekendAnurag Basu's 'Metro... In Dino' has already surpassed the lifetime earnings of his 2007 romantic classic, 'Life... in a Metro'. The film had an interesting opening weekend, but Monday will determine its true position at the box office.

Shraddha Kapoor shares fun dance reel, but fans spot Rahul Mody behind the cameraActor Shraddha Kapoor shared a playful video with fans spotting her rumoured boyfriend Rahul Mody filming it. The duo is yet to officially confirm their relationship.

Rashmika Mandanna on Deepika's 8-hour shift debate: Up to actor and film's teamRashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, talked about the eight-hour shift debate amid Deepika Padukone's exit from Sandeep Reddy Vanga's over fixed work timings. She explained the working hours in South and Hindi film industries.

Sara Arjun, 20, romancing Ranveer Singh, 40, in Dhurandhar sparks age-gap debateRanveer Singh's pairing with Sara Arjun in their upcoming film, 'Dhurandhar', has sparked a social media debate about their 20-year age gap. Sara Arjun is a popular actor in Tamil cinema.

Vikrant Massey on Deepika Padukone's 8-hour shift request: She deserves itActor Vikrant Massey has backed his 'Chhapaak' (2020) co-star Deepika Padukone's call for shorter work shifts. He also reflected on the importance of flexible timings and financial considerations.

Samantha gets emotional during speech at US event for Telugu communityActor Samantha Ruth Prabhu was recently moved to tears during her speech at Telugu Association of North America (TANA) 2025 event. She addressed the North American Telugu community in her speech.

Madhavan gives shout-out to Priyanka's performance in Heads of State, actor reactsActor Priyanka Chopra recently responded to R Madhavan's praise for her performance in 'Heads of State'. The latter expressed pride in her achievements and Hollywood fame.

Jackson Wang to light up Kapil Sharma Show with Vijay Varma, Pratik Gandhi. WatchK-pop idol Jackson Wang is all set to appear in the next episode of Netflix's 'The Great Indian Kapil Show'. He was joined by Vijay Varma, Jeetendra Kumar, Pratik Gandhi, and Jaideep Ahlawat.

Kareena Kapoor takes a dig at Prada, flaunts her OG Kolhapuri footwearActor Kareena Kapoor flaunted her OG Kolhapuri footwear as she took a dig at Prada following the latest controversy. The luxury brand was called out for copying traditional Kolhapuri chappal designs.

Dhurandhar 1st look X review: Fans call Ranveer Singh a beast in new spy-thrillerRanveer Singh surprised fans with the first look of his upcoming film 'Dhurandhar'. The action-packed theme of the spy-thriller received appreciation from fans.

Actor Richard Gere attends Dalai Lama's 90th birthday, seeks his blessingsActor Richard Gere attended the 14th Dalai Lama's 90th birthday celebrations in Dharamshala. In a heartfelt moment, the Hollywood star was seen receiving blessings from the Tibetan spiritual leader.

KJo wishes lord of bling Ranveer Singh, shares his sweet gesture for wife DeepikaKaran Johar shared a special post to celebrate Ranveer Singh's 40th birthday. The filmmaker wrote a heartfelt note and praised the actor's style and what he does to make his wife Deepika Padukone smile.

Pushpa reunion in US: Allu Arjun joins Sukumar, Sreeleela, recites iconic dialogueAllu Arjun paid tribute to Telugu culture and cinema at the North American Telugu Society (NATS) with his iconic dialogue from 'Pushpa 2'. He also felicitated director K Raghvendra Rao at the event.

Dhurandhar first look: Ranveer Singh wreaks havoc in fierce new avatarRanveer Singh shared the gripping first look of his upcoming film 'Dhurandhar'. Also starring R Madhavan, Sanjay Dutt, Akshaye Khanna, and others in key roles, the movie will release in theatres on December 5.

Kaagaz Ke Phool: Chronicle of Guru Dutt's descent from hope to surrender'Kaagaz Ke Phool' (1959)explores the contrasting worldviews in Guru Dutt's iconic film 'Pyaasa' (1957). While 'Pyaasa' portrays the artist's defiance against a shallow society, embracing authenticity and love, 'Kaagaz Ke Phool' presents a tragic tale of surrender, loneliness, and despair.

general news.headline: Trump warns extra 10% tariff on nations backing Brics' 'anti-American policies'Donald Trump threatened an extra 10 per cent tariff on nations backing Brics' "anti-American policies", hours after Brics leaders criticised rising US tariffs but avoided naming him in their Rio Declaration.

China used its missions to foil Rafale jets' sales after Op Sindoor: ReportTo hammer the Rafale fighter jets' reputation, China's foreign missions sought to persuade countries that ordered the French-made fighter not to buy them and encourage others to go for Chinese-made planes.

What's Truth Social? Musk's swipe at Trump after he jabs him over his America PartyTech titan Elon Musk has hit back at US President Donald Trump over his attack on his America Party, questioning about Truth Social and claiming he had never heard of the platform.

Voter rolls revision is legal, moral and essential. So, what's the problem?An intensive vetting of electoral rolls is a must to ensure that only Indian citizens get to decide on the country's politics and policy. If the Election Commission (EC) is mandated to conduct a special intensive revision (SIR) of voter lists, why is there such opposition to the exercise in Bihar from political parties?

Seam, skid and spirit: Akash Deep turns Edgbaston into spectacle of English mayhemEngland vs India, 2nd Test: Akash Deep turned Edgbaston into his personal crime scene, leaving behind a trail of shattered stumps and broken batting egos. Armed with skiddy seamers and a fearless heart, he's rewritten his story: from forgotten backup to India's dangerous weapon.

Extradition process begins to bring terrorist Happy Passia to India: SourcesPassia was arrested on April 17 in California's Sacramento by US Immigration and Customs Enforcement following sustained coordination with Indian agencies.

Tariffs on steel, auto unlikely in interim trade deal with US: Government sourcesWith the US to soon notify countries of higher tariffs by July 9, with new rates effective August 1, sectoral levies on steel, auto and aluminium are unlikely in the India-US interim trade deal, government sources said.

World on brink of third World War, warns Nitin Gadkari amid global conflictsNitin Gadkari said that the ongoing geopolitical conflicts risk a situation in which a World War could break out 'anytime' amid the ongoing Russia-Ukraine and Israel-Iran conflict.

Selfish Norris, Piastri slammed for ignoring Hulkenberg on British GP podiumNico Hulkenberg secured his first ever Formula 1 podium at the British Grand Prix. At the celebrations, he was ignored by both McLaren drivers.

Canara Bank customer pleads 'I don't know English', staff can't speak KannadaA Kannada-speaking woman in Chikkamagaluru was unable to get help from a Canara Bank staffer who didn't speak the language. This triggered public outrage by pro-Kannada groups and renewed demands for Kannada-speaking personnel in rural bank branches.

Bilawal Bhutto says ready to extradite Hafiz Saeed to India, draws his son's irePakistan was open to handing over terrorists Hafiz Saeed and Masood Azhar to India, former Foreign Minister Bilawal Bhutto Zardari said. However, Hafiz Saeed's son, Talha Saeed, hit back saying Bilawal's statement was wrong.

My sister has cancer: Emotional Akash Deep dedicates Edgbaston win to brave siblingEngland vs India, 2nd Test: Akash Deep played a match-winning role in India's 336-run victory over England in Birmingham. He dedicated his 10-wicket haul to his sister, who has been battling cancer for two months.

Sara Arjun, 20, romancing Ranveer Singh, 40, in Dhurandhar sparks age-gap debateRanveer Singh's pairing with Sara Arjun in their upcoming film, 'Dhurandhar', has sparked a social media debate about their 20-year age gap. Sara Arjun is a popular actor in Tamil cinema.

It was an attack on all of humanity: PM condemns Pahalgam carnage at BricsPrime Minister Narendra Modi condemned the Pahalgam terror attack while addressing the issue of terrorism at 17th Brics Summit in Brazil.
Patna businessman's murder accused detained when he came to attend funeralOne of the accused in the murder of Gopal Khemka in Bihar was detained as he arrived at the industrialist's funeral.

I have no funds, no cabinet: Kangana Ranaut's bizarre recipe for disaster reliefIn shocking remarks, BJP MP Kangana Ranaut said she neither had disaster relief funds nor a Cabinet post, but stressed she was making efforts to get central assistance for rain-hit Himachal Pradesh.

Boy recreates The Undertaker's grand entry with father, WWE legend reacts to videoA father-son duo brought the spirit of World Wrestling Entertainment (WWE) home when the father recreated The Undertaker's legendary entrance for his young son, earning a nod from The Deadman himself.

Wimbledon organisers apologise after line-calling system failureWimbledon's decision to fully rely on automated line-calling came under sharp scrutiny on Sunday after a glaring malfunction denied Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova a crucial point during her last-16 clash against Britain's Sonay Kartal on Centre Court. The system, which controversially replaced human line judges this year, failed at a key moment, sparking confusion and outrage.

Magnus Carlsen trolls haters after Grand Chess Tour Zagreb win, deletes post laterWorld No. 1 Magnus Carlsen won the SuperUnited Rapid and Blitz Croatia on Sunday, July 06, overcoming a poor Rapid section with a stellar show in the fastest format. He took a dig at his critics with a meme before deleting the post. D Gukesh finished third after slipping in Blitz rounds.

Team Uddhav taunts Raj Thackeray day after reunion rally: Had tea with Amit ShahShiv Sena (UBT) MP Sanjay Raut took a sharp dig at Raj Thackeray in his weekly column 'Rokthok', questioning the political direction of the Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS).

Rashmika Mandanna on Deepika's 8-hour shift debate: Up to actor and film's teamRashmika Mandanna, in a recent interview, talked about the eight-hour shift debate amid Deepika Padukone's exit from Sandeep Reddy Vanga's over fixed work timings. She explained the working hours in South and Hindi film industries.

Body blow for Bazball as Shubman Gill's India storm Birmingham bastionEngland (ENG) vs India (IND), 2nd Test: Shubman Gill's record-breaking run with the bat and an inspired bowling show, sans Jasprit Bumrah, helped India hammer England by 336 runs in Birmingham. India recovered from the heartbreak of Leeds to win for the first time at Edgbaston.

Global South a victim of double standards: PM bats for inclusion at BricsPrime Minister Narendra Modi strongly advocated for comprehensive reforms to ensure inclusion and better representation of the Global South, while addressing the Brics summit in Brazil.

Trump reveals tariff letter plan with a twist: Here's what's coming nextTrump also said that any country supporting what he called the 'Anti-American policies' of the BRICS group will face an additional 10% tariff.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill warns declining Dukes ball quality is hurting Test cricket's balanceIndia captain Shubman Gill on Sunday slammed the fast-deteriorating quality of the Dukes ball, while also giving a thumbs down to the trend of flat pitches seen in the first two Tests of the series — despite his own prolific run.

Watch: MS Dhoni celebrates his 44th birthday with friends, cake and warm wishesMS Dhoni rang in his 44th birthday on Monday with a low-key celebration in Ranchi, surrounded by close friends and familiar faces. A clip from the evening - showing the former India captain in a sleeveless T-shirt, cutting cake and sharing laughs - quickly went viral, giving fans a heartwarming glimpse into the cricketer's special day.

Selfish Norris, Piastri slammed for ignoring Hulkenberg on British GP podiumNico Hulkenberg secured his first ever Formula 1 podium at the British Grand Prix. At the celebrations, he was ignored by both McLaren drivers.

Day 8 schedule: Novak Djokovic, Jannik Sinner, Iga Swiatek take center stageOlympic champion Novak Djokovic and world No. 1 Jannik Sinner headline a star-studded Centre Court line-up on Monday (7 July) as Wimbledon 2025 enters its second week at the All England Club.

Mexico beat USA 2-1 to retain Gold Cup, clinches record-extending 10th titleMexico overcame the United States 2-1 on Sunday at NRG Stadium in Houston, Texas, to successfully defend their CONCACAF Gold Cup trophy and win their 10th title in a thrilling final that was filled with drama from start to finish.

Armed with skiddy seamers and a fearless heart, he's rewritten his story: from forgotten backup to India's dangerous weapon.

Watch: English fan sings a song for Akash Deep after Edgbaston Test heroicsEngland vs India: After helping India crush England by 336 runs to level the series at Edgbaston, Akash Deep received a heartwarming tribute — an English fan singing a song in his honour outside the stadium.

Gill prepares to hunt down Gavaskar, Bradman after epic start to seriesShubman Gill has scored three centuries in the first two Tests against England. His exceptional form puts him on track to break historic records held by Gavaskar and Bradman.

Wimbledon organisers apologise after line-calling system failureWimbledon's decision to fully rely on automated line-calling came under sharp scrutiny on Sunday after a glaring malfunction denied Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova a crucial point during her last-16 clash against Britain's Sonay Kartal on Centre Court. The system, which controversially replaced human line judges this year, failed at a key moment, sparking confusion and outrage.

England add Gus Atkinson to bolster bowling after Edgbaston loss vs IndiaEngland vs India: England have added pacer Gus Atkinson to their squad ahead of their third Test match against India, set to be held at Lord's in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

How Akash Deep used T20 skills to dismantle Bazball in BirminghamIndia fast bowler Akash Deep successfully filled in the massive shoes of Jasprit Bumrah as he helped India register a historic win in the second Test at Edgbaston, Birmingham with a ten-wicket haul. He even used his T20 skills to outfox batters and dismantle England's Bazball strategy.

Watch: English fan sings a song for Akash Deep after Edgbaston Test heroicsEngland vs India: After helping India crush England by 336 runs to level the series at Edgbaston, Akash Deep received a heartwarming tribute — an English fan singing a song in his honour outside the stadium.

Gill prepares to hunt down Gavaskar, Bradman after epic start to seriesShubman Gill has scored three centuries in the first two Tests against England. His exceptional form puts him on track to break historic records held by Gavaskar and Bradman.

Wimbledon organisers apologise after line-calling system failureWimbledon's decision to fully rely on automated line-calling came under sharp scrutiny on Sunday after a glaring malfunction denied Anastasia Pavlyuchenkova a crucial point during her last-16 clash against Britain's Sonay Kartal on Centre Court. The system, which controversially replaced human line judges this year, failed at a key moment, sparking confusion and outrage.

England add Gus Atkinson to bolster bowling after Edgbaston loss vs IndiaEngland vs India: England have added pacer Gus Atkinson to their squad ahead of their third Test match against India, set to be held at Lord's in the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy.

How Akash Deep used T20 skills to dismantle Bazball in BirminghamIndia fast bowler Akash Deep successfully filled in the massive shoes of Jasprit Bumrah as he helped India register a historic win in the second Test at Edgbaston, Birmingham with a ten-wicket haul. He even used his T20 skills to outfox batters and dismantle England's Bazball strategy.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
